comments: The published work product usage view for any activity creates a roll-up of all the work products of all sub-activities/task descriptors.  As a result it needs to list all the entry and exit states of all occurrences of the work product in the sub-activities.  It does this correctly in the process editor in the tool, but not in the published site. Screen shots are attached.

Created an attachment (id=43195)
Correct view in tool

Created an attachment (id=43196)
Incorrect published view.

Created an attachment (id=43325)
Correct published view

Screen-shot showing the right information

Created an attachment (id=43326)
Patch that calls the rigth adapter
The getAttribute() method from the ComposedWPDescriptorWrapperItemProvider class was not being called.
committed to both M3 and M4 braches.

verified on build epf-composer-1.0-M5-N20060829-1815-win32
not fixed
all the entry and exit states are disappeared in browsing perspective and published site.
What do you mean with "are disappeared"?  Did you mean these columns are empty? Can you attach a screen-shot?
re-open it for double checking by developer

WPU of cp1 in authoring perspective, all wpd have entry/exit state

Created an attachment (id=49118)
this two columns are empty in browsing perspective
The XSL was passing the wrong parameters when calls the JavaScript function wbsItemHtml.initRow().  The entry and exit states values are displayed now.

verified on epf-composer-1.0-M5-N20060831-1715-win32, fixed
but got error message

steps:
1. open epf with OpenUP_library_20060825
2. create a new plugin, reference the other 2
3. add new plugin in configuration OpenUPBasic
4. create a new cp in new plugin
5. to WBS of cp
6. dnd Assess and Close-out Project to cp using copy
7. to WPU, click the + to expand

result: get an error message
